intro: Pavetta australiensis, commonly known as the Australian pavetta, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and understoreys. Pavetta australiensis is a shrub that can reach up to 2 meters in height, with opposite, oval-shaped leaves.
